description: Common OKR patterns and templates for different business scenarios

patterns.name: Growth Acceleration
patterns.description: For companies focused on rapid business growth through multiple channels

key_results.example: Increase [revenue metric] from $[baseline] to $[target] ([%] growth) while maintaining [efficiency metric] above [threshold]
Acquire [number] new [customer type] with average [value metric] of $[amount]
Achieve [percentage]% market share in [market segment] with [metric] of [target]

examples.objective: Accelerate sustainable growth through enterprise customer acquisition
key_results: Increase annual recurring revenue from $2M to $4M (100% growth) while maintaining >25% gross margin
Acquire 50 new enterprise customers with average contract value of $80K
Achieve 12% market share in mid-market CRM space with 85% customer satisfaction

when_to_use: Company has product-market fit and needs to scale
Market opportunity is large and timing is right
Team has capacity and resources for growth
success_factors: Balance growth rate with sustainability metrics
Focus on customer quality, not just quantity
Ensure operational capacity matches growth targets
common_pitfalls: Growth at any cost without profitability consideration
Focusing only on vanity metrics without business value

patterns.name: Operational Excellence
patterns.description: For improving efficiency, quality, and reliability of core business operations

template.objective: Achieve operational excellence through [specific improvement area]

key_results.example: Reduce [process] time from [baseline] to [target] while maintaining [quality metric] above [threshold]
Decrease [cost metric] from $[baseline] to $[target] ([%] reduction) without reducing [output metric]
Automate [percentage]% of [process] while achieving [reliability metric] of [target]

examples.objective: Achieve operational excellence through lean manufacturing implementation
key_results: Reduce production cycle time from 8 hours to 5 hours while maintaining 99.5% quality rate
Decrease cost per unit from $45 to $32 (29% reduction) without reducing daily output
Automate 75% of quality inspection process while achieving 99.8% defect detection rate

when_to_use: Operations are becoming bottleneck to growth
Competition is intensifying and efficiency is critical
Quality issues are affecting customer satisfaction
success_factors: Define quality metrics alongside efficiency gains
Involve operational teams in target setting
Plan for change management and training needs
common_pitfalls: Optimizing for cost without considering quality impact
Setting targets without understanding operational constraints
Focusing on internal metrics without customer value connection

patterns.name: Customer-Centric Value Creation
patterns.description: For improving customer experience, satisfaction, and lifetime value

template.objective: Maximize customer value through [specific experience/outcome improvement]

key_results.example: Increase [satisfaction metric] from [baseline] to [target] resulting in [behavior change]
Reduce [churn metric] from [baseline] to [target] while increasing [value metric] by [percentage]%
Achieve [experience metric] of [target] leading to [business outcome] improvement of [amount]

examples.objective: Maximize customer value through exceptional onboarding and support experience
key_results: Increase customer health score from 7.2 to 8.5 (1-10 scale) resulting in 25% increase in feature adoption
Reduce monthly churn rate from 5% to 3% while increasing average revenue per user by 15%
Achieve first-call resolution rate of 85% leading to NPS improvement from 42 to 60

when_to_use: Customer satisfaction or retention is below target
Growth strategy focuses on existing customer expansion
Customer experience is a competitive differentiator
success_factors: Connect experience metrics to business outcomes
Measure customer behavior change, not just sentiment
Include both leading and lagging indicators
common_pitfalls: Focusing on satisfaction scores without behavior change
Improving experience without measuring business impact
Setting targets without understanding customer journey

patterns.name: Product-Market Fit Validation
patterns.description: For validating new products, features, or market segments

key_results.example: Achieve [number] active users with [engagement metric] of [threshold] within [timeframe]
Achieve $[amount] in [revenue type] with [sustainability metric] of [target]

examples.objective: Validate AI-powered analytics feature market fit in enterprise segment
key_results: Achieve 200 active beta users with 70%+ weekly usage rate within 8 weeks
Generate 25 qualified sales leads with 40% demo-to-trial conversion rate
Achieve $100K in pre-sales commitments with 80% customer satisfaction score

when_to_use: Launching new products or major features
success_factors: Define clear success criteria before launch
Balance quantitative metrics with qualitative feedback
Set realistic timeframes for meaningful validation
common_pitfalls: Confusing vanity metrics with validation signals
Setting validation period too short for meaningful data
Focusing on features rather than customer outcomes

patterns.name: Digital Transformation
patterns.description: For modernizing technology, processes, and capabilities

template.objective: Drive digital transformation through [specific capability/process improvement]

key_results.example: Implement [technology] achieving [efficiency metric] improvement from [baseline] to [target]
Digitize [percentage]% of [process] reducing [metric] by [amount] while improving [quality metric]

examples.objective: Drive digital transformation through automated customer onboarding
key_results: Implement digital onboarding platform achieving 80% straight-through processing from current 25%
Digitize 90% of account opening process reducing completion time by 75% while improving compliance score to 98%
Build self-service capability with 70% customer adoption rate across all product lines

when_to_use: Organization is falling behind digitally native competitors
Manual processes are limiting scale and efficiency
success_factors: Focus on business outcomes, not just technology implementation
Include change management and adoption metrics
Plan for iterative improvement rather than big-bang approach
common_pitfalls: Focusing on technology features rather than business value
Setting unrealistic timeline expectations for complex transformations
